title: Blackmoorfoot Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Stephen Craven / Reservoir empty..., via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Blackmoorfoot reservoir at a very low level during the drought year of 1984.

images.title: Stephen Craven / Reservoir full, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Reservoir full. Blackmoorfoot overflowing at the end of December 1984.

images.title: Ian M / Blackmoorfoot
images.caption: The moorland hamlet of Blackmoorfoot nestles below the dam of the reservoir

images.title: Footpath towards Blackmoorfoot Reservoir by Chris Wimbush, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath south of the site.

images.title: Tim Green from Bradford, UK, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bull's Head. A nice place for some post walk refreshment in the adjacent hamlet.

images.title: Stephen Craven / Constructing the new treatment works
images.caption: Historic photo, constructing the new treatment works. Laing built the new water treatment works at Blackmoorfoot in 1983/4. These are the flocculation and flotation tanks under construction.

description: This short walk visits Blackmoorfoot Reservoir in Huddersfield. The reservoir is located a couple of miles south west of Huddersfield town centre. You can stroll along the water and then follow a bridleway through the countryside to Crosland Edge and the little village of Helme. The reservoir is surrounded by attractive woodland, countryside and views of the Yorkshire Hills. Also look out for migrating birds that visit the reservoir. There is also free parking on the lanes around the site.
